member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.PrintDialogSettings.Title
member.summary: Title of page. If you want to print Title on the page, insert code &w in Footer or Header.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.PrintDialogSettings.Footer
member.summary: Footer of page. Here you can use special codes: &w (Window title), &D, &d (Date), &t(), &4 (Time), &p (Current page number), &P (Total number of pages), && (A single ampersand), &b (Right justify text, Center text. If &b occurs once, then anything after the &b is right justified. If &b occurs twice, then anything between the two &b is centered, and anything after the second &b is right justified). More detailed see here

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.PrintDialogSettings.Header
member.summary: Header of page Here you can use special codes: &w (Window title), &D, &d (Date), &t(), &4 (Time), &p (Current page number), &P (Total number of pages), && (A single ampersand), &b (Right justify text, Center text. If &b occurs once, then anything after the &b is right justified. If &b occurs twice, then anything between the two &b is centered, and anything after the second &b is right justified). More detailed see here

member.name: M:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.SyntaxHighlighter.HighlightSyntax(System.String,Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.Range)
member.summary: Highlights syntax for given XML description file

member.name: M:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.SyntaxHighlighter.AddXmlDescription(System.String,System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary:
Uses the given to parse a XML description and adds it as syntax descriptor. The syntax descriptor is used for highlighting when
Language property of FCTB is set to
DescriptionFile property of FCTB has the same value as the method parameter

member.name: M:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.SyntaxHighlighter.AddResilientStyle(Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.Style)
member.summary: Adds the given as resilient style. A resilient style is additionally available when highlighting is based on a syntax descriptor that has been derived from a XML description file. In the run of the highlighting routine the styles used by the FCTB are always dropped and replaced with the (initial) ones from the syntax descriptor. Resilient styles are added afterwards and can be used anyway.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.DefaultStyle

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.LeftBracket
member.summary: Opening bracket for brackets highlighting. Set to '\x0' for disable brackets highlighting.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.RightBracket
member.summary: Closing bracket for brackets highlighting. Set to '\x0' for disable brackets highlighting.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.LeftBracket2
member.summary: Alternative opening bracket for brackets highlighting. Set to '\x0' for disable brackets highlighting.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.RightBracket2
member.summary: Alternative closing bracket for brackets highlighting. Set to '\x0' for disable brackets highlighting.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.HighlightingRangeType
member.summary: This property specifies which part of the text will be highlighted as you type (by built-in highlighter).
member.remarks: When a user enters text, a component refreshes highlighting (because the text was changed). This property specifies exactly which section of the text will be re-highlighted. This can be useful to highlight multi-line comments, for example.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.IsReplaceMode
member.summary: Is keyboard in replace mode (wide caret) ?

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.AllowSeveralTextStyleDrawing
member.summary: Allows text rendering several styles same time.

member.summary: Allows AutoIndent. Inserts spaces before new line.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.AutoIndentExistingLines
member.summary: Does autoindenting in existing lines. It works only if AutoIndent is True.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.ReservedCountOfLineNumberChars
member.summary: Reserved space for line number characters. If smaller than needed (e. g. line count >= 10 and this value set to 1) this value will have no impact. If you want to reserve space, e. g. for line numbers >= 10 or >= 100 than you can set this value to 2 or 3 or higher.

member.name: M:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Fast.Coloured.Text.Box.FastColouredTextBox.GetControlPanelWheelScrollLinesValue
member.summary: Gets the value for the system control panel mouse wheel scroll settings. The value returns the number of lines that shall be scolled if the user turns the mouse wheet one step.
member.remarks: This methods gets the "WheelScrollLines" value our from the registry key "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop". If the value of this option is 0, the screen will not scroll when the mouse wheel is turned. If the value of this option is -1 or is greater than the number of lines visible in the window, the screen will scroll up or down by one page.
member.returns: Number of lines to scrol l when the mouse wheel is turned
